sketch.compiler.passes.lowering

Class SemanticChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • sketch.compiler.passes.lowering.SemanticChecker

  • public class SemanticChecker
extends java.lang.Object
    Perform checks on the semantic correctness of a StreamIt program. The main entry point to this class is the static sketch.compiler.passes.SemanticChecker.check method, which returns true if a program has no detected semantic errors.
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    David Maze <dmaze@cag.lcs.mit.edu>

    • Method Detail

      • check

        public static boolean check(Program prog,
                            boolean isParseCheck)
        Check a SKETCH/PSKETCH program for semantic correctness. This returns false and prints diagnostics to standard error if errors are detected.
        Parameters:
        prog - parsed program object to check

      • check

        public static boolean check(Program prog,
                            SemanticChecker.ParallelCheckOption parallel,
                            boolean isParseCheck)
        Check a SKETCH/PSKETCH program for semantic correctness. This returns false and prints diagnostics to standard error if errors are detected.
        Parameters:
        prog - parsed program object to check
        parallel - are parallel constructs allowed?

      • checkStatementPlacement

        public void checkStatementPlacement(Program prog)
        Checks that statements exist in valid contexts for the type of statement. This checks that add, split, join, loop, and body statements are only in appropriate initialization code, and that push, pop, peek, and keep statements are only in appropriate work function code.
        Parameters:
        prog - parsed program object to check

      • banParallelConstructs

        public void banParallelConstructs(Program prog)
        Trigger a semantic error if parallel constructs are used.

      • checkParallelConstructs

        public void checkParallelConstructs(Program prog)
